txt.en: Facts and Fictions
Talk to Tafikh
Talk to Tafikh

'Ah, you came back! I did not know if you would. Does this mean you are prepared to play my game of Facts and Fictions? It will truly test how much you know about the Kindred of the Coins and the city of Umbar Baharbêl. But be warned: if you fail to answer a question correctly, it will be some time before I allow you to play again. It is only fair.

'Here is how to play. Behind me you will see the ruined structure that was the Shrine of He-Who-Sees-All. The shrine is now mere rubble, as it should be; it stands as a testament now to the evils that the Empire of Ordakh inflicted upon us. To the south-east, on the left side of the ruin, I have erected a red canopy. There is a similar canopy to the south, on the right side of the ruin; that one is made of green cloth.

'I will make a series of five statements. If the statement is true, you will stand under the green canopy. If the statement is false, you will stand under the red canopy. Return to me after each answer to hear the next statement. However, if you get one wrong you will need to begin my game again from the top... after spending a period of time mourning your lack of knowledge. Are you ready? Speak to me to begin.'
Wrong answer! The game is over
Talk to Tafikh
Wrong answer! The game is over
Talk to Tafikh
'Then let us begin.\n\n'Belondor, Kinsman of the Fleet-fast, is married to an Umbari woman named Khâsha.'
You are correct, and advance to the next round!

'Very good. A lucky guess. Next question.\n\n'Azagath Sea-shadow has been known to walk through the markets of Umbar Baharbêl.'
'Well?'
You are correct, and advance to the next round!

<rgb=#FFFF00>'The name of this land comes from the word Umbru-mâra, which means 'Fruitful Land.''</rgb>

If the statement is <rgb=#00FF00>True</rgb>, stand under the green canopy

Talk to Tafikh
'Yes. This next one will not be easy.\n\n'The Church of the All-Seeing prized the sea-opal Abâshal, and used it to decorate its places of worship.'
Tafikh has challenged you to a game of Facts and Fictions, believing that you do not know enough about the people of Umbar Baharbêl and the Kindred of the Coins.
'Well?'
Tafikh is waiting to ask you her third question.
Tafikh is waiting to ask you her first question.
'Fine, you got it. How about this one?\n\n'The Sea-stone Mutiny, during which the Heirs of Castamir were overthrown, began in the Upper Ward of the city.'
Question Three:\nThe Church of the All-Seeing prized the sea-opal Abâshal, and used it to decorate its places of worship.
Question One:\nBelondor, Kinsman of the Fleet-fast, is married to an Umbari woman named Khâsha.
'Well?'
Tafikh is waiting to ask you her fourth question.
Tafikh is waiting to ask you her second question.
Question Four:\nThe Sea-stone Mutiny, during which the Heirs of Castamir were overthrown, began in the Upper Ward of the city.
Question Two:\nAzagath Sea-shadow has been known to walk through the markets of Umbar Baharbêl.
Tafikh is waiting to ask you her fifth question.
Wrong answer! The game is over
Wrong answer! The game is over
Question Five:\nThe name of this land comes from the word Umbru-mâra, which means 'Fruitful Land.'
Tafikh is amazed that you answered all of her questions correctly.
'You think you are smart? Then let us see your mastery of the language! This is the last question.\n\n'The name of this land comes from the word Umbru-mâra, which means 'Fruitful Land.''
'Well?'
You are correct, and advance to the next round!

'I must admit I did not think you would defeat my game, but you have proven a master of Facts and Fictions! Well done, stranger! May you continue to use your knowledge of our land and our city to better the lives of its people! I must give you the reward I thought to keep for myself, for you have bested me in this contest as few before have done!'
Wrong answer! The game is over
